bugs.title: CVE-2024-26817 kernel: amdkfd: use calloc instead of kzalloc to avoid integer overflow [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-26817 kernel: amdkfd: use calloc instead of kzalloc to avoid integer overflow [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-26817 kernel: amdkfd: use calloc instead of kzalloc to avoid integer overflow

long_desc.thetext:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

amdkfd: use calloc instead of kzalloc to avoid integer overflow

The Linux kernel CVE team has assigned CVE-2024-26817 to this issue.

Upstream advisory:
https://lore.kernel.org/linux-cve-announce/2024041311-CVE-2024-26817-e1a0@gregkh/T

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2274990]

The result of automatic check (that is developed by Alexander Larkin) for this CVE-2024-26817 is: 	SKIP	No affected files built, so skip this CVE	NO			-	-	unknown (where first YES/NO value means if related sources built).

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2274989

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Reproducers, if any, will remain confidential and never be made public, unless done so by the security team.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2274989,2274990

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

FEDORA-2024-f93cdd8831 (kernel-6.8.6-200.fc39) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 39.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-f93cdd8831

FEDORA-2024-f93cdd8831 (kernel-6.8.6-200.fc39) has been pushed to the Fedora 39 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by jforbes.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'waiting'.
default & performance tests pass (KVM)

Host: KVM/QEMU Standard PC (Q35 + ICH9, 2009) (pc-q35-7.2) CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-4790K (8) @ 3.99 GHz Memory: 2.82 GiB

Test regression and Performance. PASSED
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'passed'.
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update can be pushed to stable now if the maintainer wishes
Works.

Works for me. The enabled Default and Performance tests pass OK.  
Work Station, Asus prime mobo - Ryzen5 5600g/AMDGPU, 400 Series Chipset, (UEFI) Secure boot, SSD's > RAID1 (ext4)
Seems to work fine on bare-metal HP Z440, AMD RX570 with UEFI. Kernel regression tests both PASS, but I haven't tested the previously reported bugs/traces regarding amdgpu yet.
LGTM: Framework laptop 13 AMD 7840U LUKS/btrfs GNOME/Wayland
Can't boot when installed on Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-6700 CPU @ 3.40GHz.  Boots OK on Intel(R) Xeon(R) W-2225 CPU @ 4.10GHz.
Working fine as a VirtualBox guest.
jforbes edited this update.
